task.title: Accessing the
task.shortdesc: Access the on the API Catalog page.

ol.li: Authorize the APIs and define a REST endpoint for the APIs that you want to view in the .
Deploy the API to an Environment that has an Atom with an API Type set to Advanced in the Shared Web Server settings of Atom Management in .

prereq.note: To avoid a "Failed to load specification" error, rename the default root node name of the imported JSON profiles in the Profile component.

step.cmd: Go to the Configure APIs and Applications Deployed APIs page.

stepresult.p: Your currently deployed API Service and API Proxy components display.

step.cmd: Find the API Service component that you want to view the for and click View in the Details column.
Click on the REST tab and then click Access .
Based on the Authentication Type set on your Atom in the Atom ManagementShared Web Server panel of , the following situations occur:

choices.choice: If no authentication (None) is set, the portal opens without requiring additional credentials.
If Basic authentication type is set and more than one user is specified on the User Management tab of the Shared Web Server panel, enter your User Name and Password. Click Open.

If External Provider type is set, select the desired credentials for API Contract, Application, and API Key. Click Open and enter your credentials set against your identity provider.
For the External Provider setting, a web proxy window opens stating that the Authorization Code was received. Optionally, close this window to return to the .
If multiple authentication methods are configured for an Atom, the default authentication method configured in Shared Web Server settings is used.

taskbody.result: The opens a new tab in your internet browser.
